result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:33 AM Defendant Daniel P Berczyk in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Daniel P Berczyk.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases called for status. 
In case 22CF1405: 
The defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.
Court finds the defendant knowingly, freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their right to a preliminary hearing and finds probable cause to bind over the defendant over for trial.
Information filed.    Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
State sends consolidated offer.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 6, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Letter from Attorney Griffis requesting that the defendant be allowed to appear by Zoom for the upcoming status hearing.

11:11 AM Defendant Daniel P Berczyk appeared by video.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Daniel P Berczyk. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. 
Case called for status. 
Defense has received paper discovery, but is waiting on electronic discovery. 
Defense has received a pre-trial offer and negotiations are ongoing.
Hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:22 AM Defendant Daniel P Berczyk in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.  Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 27, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Filed by Atty Griffis- Request to adjourn court date
  **Reviewed by Commissioner Daniel Rieck on 07-12-2022. "The Court is not opposed to one last adjournment provided the State first says it is also not opposed."
Preliminary hearing on July 13, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Atty Griffis would like to reschedule prelim - sent to CC Rieck to review. Court's response: As there are no victim's rights/Marsy's Law implications, adjournment is approved. Time limits previously waived.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

02:36 PM Defendant Daniel P Berczyk in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:15 am.
